Sentencas: The present study is focused on the development of alternative oxygen electrodes for Solid Oxide Electrolysis Cells (SOECs).
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Rare earth nickelates with general formula Ln(2)NiO(4+delta) (Ln = La, Pr or Nd) have shown good performance as oxygen electrodes with various electrolytes.
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Among them, La2NiO4+delta is most stable nickelate by itself however its electrochemical performance is lower compare to Pr2NiO4+delta.
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Therefore, to further enhance the physico-chemical properties, electrochemical performance of La2NiO4+delta as SOECs oxygen electrode, herein, we have performed the substitution of nickel with cobalt.
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: Three compositions (x = 0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) were mainly considered and completely characterized using several techniques.
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The symmetrical as well as single cells were then prepared and electrochemically characterized using DC- and AC-techniques in the temperature range 700-900 degrees C.
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: The electrode reaction mechanism was also investigated by recording the impedance spectra at different pO(2).
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells

Sentencas: With cobalt substitution, an improvement in electrochemical performance as well lower degradation rate is observed during long term SOEC operation at -1 A.cm(-2) current density at 800 degrees C with 50% H-2 and 50% H2O feed gas mixture.
Titulo: La2Ni1-xCoxO4+δ (x=0.0, 0.1 and 0.2) based efficient oxygen electrode materials for solid oxide electrolysis cells
